title: Economists Expect February Jobs Report to Show Steady Hiring as Omicron Effects Faded
sub_head: But rising oil prices and looming rate increases from the Fed pose new threats to the jobs recovery
body:
The U.S. job market appears to have grown steadily in February, according to economists, as Covid-19 infections fell sharply and the country pivoted toward a post-pandemic world.
But the labor market is suddenly facing new threats that could impede further job growth: soaring oil prices, geopolitical turmoil in Europe and looming rate increases from the Federal Reserve.
